semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Type 1 STEMI and NSTEMI Including Evolution and Conversion Rules
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Diseases of the Circulatory System > e. Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) > 1) Type 1 ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI)

content.full_text: The ICD-10-CM codes for type 1 acute myocardial infarction (AMI) identify the site, such as anterolateral wall or true posterior wall. Subcategories I21.0-I21.2 and code I21.3 are used for type 1 ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI). Code I21.4, Non-ST elevation (NSTEMI) myocardial infarction, is used for type 1 non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI) and nontransmural MIs. If a type 1 NSTEMI evolves to STEMI, assign the STEMI code. If a type 1 STEMI converts to NSTEMI due to thrombolytic therapy, it is still coded as STEMI. For encounters occurring while the myocardial infarction is equal to, or less than, four weeks old, including transfers to another acute setting or a postacute setting, and the myocardial infarction meets the definition for "other diagnoses" (see Section III, Reporting Additional Diagnoses), codes from category I21 may continue to be reported. For encounters after the 4-week time frame and the patient is still receiving care related to the myocardial infarction, the appropriate aftercare code should be assigned, rather than a code from category I21. For old or healed myocardial infarctions not requiring further care, code I25.2, Old myocardial infarction, may be assigned. (Evidence: pg no: 54, L85-L97)
content.summary: Comprehensive guidelines for coding Type 1 STEMI and NSTEMI including site identification, evolution rules, and time-based coding requirements (Evidence: pg no: 54, L85-L97)
key_concepts: Type 1 AMI site identification (Evidence: pg no: 54, L88-L89)
STEMI subcategories I21.0-I21.3 (Evidence: pg no: 54, L90-L91)
NSTEMI code I21.4 (Evidence: pg no: 54, L91-L92)
Evolution and conversion rules (Evidence: pg no: 54, L93-L94)
Four-week time frame rule (Evidence: pg no: 54, L95-L96)
Aftercare coding after 4 weeks (Evidence: pg no: 54, L96-L97)
Old MI coding (Evidence: pg no: 54, L97)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I21.0-I21.3 for Type 1 STEMI with site identification (Evidence: pg no: 54, L88-L91)
detailed_rules.explanation: Type 1 acute myocardial infarction codes identify the anatomical site, with subcategories I21.0-I21.2 and code I21.3 used for STEMI (Evidence: pg no: 54, L88-L91)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I21.4 for Type 1 NSTEMI and nontransmural MIs (Evidence: pg no: 54, L91-L92)
detailed_rules.explanation: Code I21.4 is used for type 1 non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI) and nontransmural MIs (Evidence: pg no: 54, L91-L92)

detailed_rules.rule_text: NSTEMI evolving to STEMI gets STEMI code (Evidence: pg no: 54, L93)
detailed_rules.explanation: If a type 1 NSTEMI evolves to STEMI during the encounter, assign the STEMI code (Evidence: pg no: 54, L93)

detailed_rules.rule_text: STEMI converting to NSTEMI due to thrombolytics still coded as STEMI (Evidence: pg no: 54, L93-L94)
detailed_rules.explanation: If a type 1 STEMI converts to NSTEMI due to thrombolytic therapy, it is still coded as STEMI (Evidence: pg no: 54, L93-L94)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I21 codes for encounters within 4 weeks (Evidence: pg no: 54, L95-L96)
detailed_rules.explanation: For encounters while MI is 4 weeks old or less, including transfers, I21 codes may continue to be used if meeting other diagnoses criteria (Evidence: pg no: 54, L95-L96)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use aftercare codes after 4 weeks for ongoing MI care (Evidence: pg no: 54, L96-L97)
detailed_rules.explanation: For encounters after 4 weeks when patient still receiving MI-related care, use appropriate aftercare code rather than I21 (Evidence: pg no: 54, L96-L97)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I25.2 for old/healed MI not requiring further care (Evidence: pg no: 54, L97)
detailed_rules.explanation: For old or healed myocardial infarctions not requiring further care, code I25.2, Old myocardial infarction, may be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 54, L97)
common_applications: History of MI without current issues

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine if STEMI or NSTEMI
Step 3: Identify anatomical site for STEMI
Step 4: Check for evolution or conversion
Step 5: Determine time frame from MI onset
Step 6: Apply appropriate coding based on time and care status

incorrect_coding.rationale: Would miss the evolution to STEMI

best_practices: Apply evolution and conversion rules correctly (Evidence: pg no: 54, L93-L94)
Follow 4-week time frame rule strictly (Evidence: pg no: 54, L95-L96)

tips: Document anatomical site for STEMI coding (Evidence: pg no: 54, L88-L89)
Track time from MI onset for proper coding (Evidence: pg no: 54, L95-L96)
